rationale: The app has zero Error Boundary components (confirmed by searching for 'ErrorBoundary' across the entire frontend src). If any component throws a runtime error (e.g., accessing a property on undefined data, a rendering bug), React unmounts the entire component tree and the user sees a blank white page with no way to recover except a full browser refresh. For a construction operations platform used on job sites, this is especially problematic.
problemSolved: No Error Boundary exists anywhere in the application. The App.tsx contains only a React Router with route definitions. The Layout.tsx wraps page content but has no error catching. Any unhandled runtime error in any component will crash the entire app to a white screen.
